Articles.Content:
Hello, I'm Nigel (known as Darth Nigel in a couple of places because of a car I used to own).

I've been building quadcopters and flying stuff for fun, but winter is here (which in Seattle is mostly wind and rain), so I figured I needed something to fill my time. I'd been reading about KSP on fark.com of all places, and it looked interesting.

So I downloaded the demo, and it overloaded my ancient MacBook. But I had a birthday recently, and got a shiny new MacBook which runs KSP something wonderful.

Looking forward to getting my Kerbals "to infinity and beyond", or at least to a MÃƒÂ¼nar orbit. Right now, I'm watching videos and putting out fires on the launchpad.

Keep watching the skies, especially the parts that are on fire and heading towards you.

Nigel

because of a car I used to own
Big gray thing the size of a small moon?

Has anyone else noticed that we get like 10 new people every week?

Where slowly concurring the universe!

Any how welcome to the forums Nigel UNO may your flights be prosperous and filled with kerbal 2x4 technology science! (Is an old cartoon joke )

And if you ever feel the need to fly a little less vertically and more horizontally PM me if you need help!

Big gray thing the size of a small moon?

Close... a 1972 Plymouth Fury II painted matte black. Was a former RCMP Highway Interceptor, had a huge engine, 4-barrel carb and would still pass anything on the road (except a gas station). T'was known as the Death Star, and had a reputation (before I got it) as "This car has been in 16 accidents, and hasn't lost one yet!"

Don't know how appropriate it is to post pictures, but picture this in black (http://carphotos.cardomain.com/ride_images/3/3219/3061/33046530001_original.jpg)

... would still pass anything on the road (except a gas station)...

I'm laughing at my job. Out loud.

This is bad.
